ngiemboon: Mandoshÿe la gwɔ́ tà ńzsé mmó gie á ne ńcʉate, éshʉate menzsǒ mé, ńkaa pɔ̀ɔn éshu, ńdɔg ńdúŋ, ńtúʼu pfó shʉ́a. Ńdɔg ńgʉa né tÿǒsoŋ, ńgiŋe ńgaʼte lé tʉ̀.
en: When Mordecai learned all that had occurred,   he tore his clothes,  # 4:1 2Sm 1:11; 3:31; Ezr 9:3 put on sackcloth and ashes,  # 4:1 Is 58:5; Dn 9:3 went into the middle of the city, and cried loudly and bitterly.  # 4:1 Ex 11:6

ngiemboon: À la lɔg ńgʉa tà ńkúu gyǎ nɔʼ ńtyé; á nue á la te ne ńzɛ́te ngie nyìŋ gẅie à kǎa pɔ̀ɔn éshu, ńdɔg ne ńdúŋo mmó, à kúu nɔʼ wɔ́.
en: He went only as far as the King’s Gate,   since the law prohibited anyone wearing sackcloth from entering the King’s Gate.

ngiemboon: À la gwaa gÿo púʼu á gwɔ́ tsɛ̀ɛ yɛ̌ pàga láʼ wɔ́ɔ, á jʉʼ gie mé ka tóŋ lepʉ̌ sie fùɔ ka ŋweʼe ńzáb á wó, pʉ̀a Yúndà tÿɔ́g pɔ́ legwé ńne ńdʉa; ńkwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè ńne sẅíŋte Ssé, ńne ńdʉa, ńne ńcúɔ mbùm yɔb, lelÿò pʉ̀a kaa mepɔ̀ɔn éshu, ńnuŋe tsɛ̀ɛ pfó, ńdɔg ńdúŋ.
en: There was great mourning among the Jewish people in every province where the king’s command and edict   reached. They fasted, wept, and lamented, and many lay in sackcloth and ashes.  # 4:3 Est 8:17; Is 58:5; Dn 9:3; Jnh 3:5–6

ngiemboon: Epúɔ panzwě pie é lɔ́ɔn faʼa mbwó Ésétà pâ pʉ̀a pie mé la shʉ́ʉ wɔ́b pɔ́ piŋe ḿbyɛ́bɛ yé, é tó ḿbú shwóŋo yé páʼ Mandoshÿe cʉ́ʼ ńgwɔ́, Ésétà júʼ, ḿbú ńcÿɔʼ tà ńtúm ngie mé gʉa ńná menzsǒ né Mandoshÿe ngie à lɔg ńkúbe menzẅìŋ pɔ̀ɔn mie à kǎ shu. Táʼ á lʉʼʉ lémaʼ.
en: Esther’s female servants and her eunuchs came and reported the news to her, and the queen was overcome with fear.   She sent clothes for Mordecai to wear so that he would take off his sackcloth, but he did not accept them.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ púʼu, Ésétà tóŋo Hatag gẅie à lɔ̌ɔn faʼa mbwó yé, ńgwɔ́ tsɔ̌ tàʼ na pʉ̀a pie mé la shʉ́ʉ wɔ́b, pɔ́ pyɛ́bɛ mezwě fùɔ. À la túmo yé ngie à gʉa ńzɛ́te Mandoshÿe mmó gie á ne ńcʉate, tá à piŋ fó mǒ ńzsé mmó gie á gÿǒ, tá á gÿo mmó gie à ne ńgÿo lɛ̂.
en: Esther summoned Hathach, one of the king’s eunuchs who attended her, and dispatched him to Mordecai to learn what he was doing and why.

ngiemboon: Hatag kẅɛ ńgʉa ńgyá Mandoshÿe na jʉʼ gie á laa tÿǒsoŋ, ńgwɔ́ mvfò ncwò nkáʼ gẅie mé tóŋo lê ncwò ndá fùɔ.
en: So Hathach went out to Mordecai in the city square in front of the King’s Gate.

ngiemboon: Mandoshÿe leen ńké shwóŋo yé kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie á gee ngÿǒ, mbɔɔ mendèndàʼ mie é tsẅéʼe na nkáb gie Hamaŋ la pÿé mbwó fùɔ páʼ à ge ná mé néŋe tsɛ̀ɛ kʉbé nkáb fùɔ lélɔg ńgÿo mé pyág pʉ̀a Yúndà.
en: Mordecai told him everything that had happened as well as the exact amount of money Haman had promised to pay the royal treasury for the slaughter of the Jews.

ngiemboon: À la gíŋe ńnáa yetsɔ́ ŋwàʼne gie mé ka ŋweʼe á Sẅísè, lélɔg ḿbyág pʉ̀a Yúndà légwɔ́ gie à lɔg ńgʉa ńtó nyɛɛ Ésétà; à la gẅiin lépiŋ nzèm, ḿbíte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ éshwóŋo Ésétà, ḿbiŋ ńtsẅi né yé ngie à gʉa gyá fùɔ, ésẅíŋte légwɔ́ gie à gẅiin tsɔ́ɔnmezìŋe nzèm pʉ̀a láʼ pé pʉ̀a Yúndà.
en: Mordecai also gave him a copy of the written decree issued in Susa ordering their destruction, so that Hathach might show it to Esther, explain it to her, and command her to approach the king, implore his favor, and plead with him personally for her people.

ngiemboon: Hatag piŋ nzèm ḿbú ḿbíte kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ gie Mandoshÿe gɔ̌ɔn, éshwóŋo Ésétà.
en: Hathach came and repeated Mordecai’s response to Esther.

ngiemboon: Ésétà tsẅi né yé, ngie à gʉa ńgɔɔn né Mandoshÿe ngie:
en: Esther spoke to Hathach and commanded him to tell Mordecai,

ngiemboon: Mânyìŋ ntsèm, é megàŋafàʼ fùɔ, é pʉ̀a pie tsẅé tsɛ̀ɛ meláʼ mie fùɔ sáʼa, á mámbàŋa kà manzwě wɔ́ɔ, pɔ́ ne ńzsé ngie nyìŋ gẅie à cʉ́ʼʉ létóo mvfò fùɔ, ḿpfó na tetʉ́a ye tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ, té gwɔ́ gie mé tóŋo yé, mbà ngàŋ gẅiin lékwé. Ngwɔ́ ngàŋ gwaa tsẅɛ́ ńtí pɔ́ páʼ fùɔ teʼé tÿǒ lefùɔ ńdɔg ńdíe yé, á tÿǒ gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ́ʉ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte. Nyìŋ gẅie mé té yé lepʉ̌ sɔɔn gwǒon yé wɔ́, aa nyìŋ gẅie fùɔ ge téʼe tÿǒ yé gie mé la lɔgɔ tʉ̌ ngɔ̂ɔ ńnyɛte, é lɔg líe yé. À yɔ̀ɔn mbà é gÿǒ lyɛʼɛ́ láʼ móm ntá páʼ fùɔ kaa gíŋe ńtóŋo wɔ́ɔn ndá yé wɔ́.
en: “All the royal officials and the people of the royal provinces know that one law applies to every man or woman who approaches the king in the inner courtyard   and who has not been summoned #— #the death penalty  # 4:11 Dn 2:9,12–13  #— # unless the king extends the gold scepter, allowing that person to live.  # 4:11 Est 5:2; 8:4 I have not been summoned to appear before the king  # 4:11 Est 2:14 for the last  # 4:11 Lit king these thirty days.”

ngiemboon: Hatag gʉa shwóŋo Mandoshÿe mmó gie Ésétà gɔ̌ɔn.
en: Esther’s response was reported to Mordecai.

ngiemboon: Mandoshÿe gɔɔn ngie mé gɔɔn né Ésétà ngie: Te kwaŋ ngie gù zɔ ge láʼ gʉa na pʉ̀a Yúndà tsẅɛ gíle gù á nue ɔ̀ tsẅé nɔʼ.
en: Mordecai told the messenger to reply to Esther, “Don’t think that you will escape the fate of all the Jews because you are in the king’s palace.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ lɔɔn te gɔɔn jú nò jʉʼɔɔn lélɔg ńkẅéte pà Yúndà na yɔɔn nò wɔ́, mbà mé ge fó na tsɔ́ shÿó, é kẅéte wɔ́b, é gÿo pɔ́ tsẅɛ́, pi lâ jú tsìŋendá pú ńdege. Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, awɔ̌ ne ńzsé kà ɔ̀ te gwɔ́ cʉ́ʼʉ mɔ́ɔn nɔʼ pɛ́ʼɛ̀, á tíi pɔ́ yɔɔn nò wɔ́ɔ?
en: If you keep silent at this time, relief and deliverance will come to the Jewish people from another place,   but you and your father’s family will be destroyed. Who knows, perhaps you have come to your royal position for such a time as this.”  # 4:14 Gn 45:5–7

ngiemboon: Ésétà tsẅi mé gʉa ńgɔɔn né Mandoshÿe ngie:
en: Esther sent this reply to Mordecai:

ngiemboon: Gʉa ḿbú ńcúʼte pʉ̀a Yúndà pie ée Sẅísè. Pi kwoŋ kwoŋ ńnéŋe nzyè, ésẅíŋte Ssé twó mèŋ, tà pi pfɛ́ɛ mmó, tà pi nú ntse na lyɛ̌ʼ sétá, á fʉ̀ʼʉ zsǒ mbɔɔ letsẅɛ́ʼ, kwàʼ mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n ge néŋe nzyè ésẅíŋte Ssé, peg lâ megàŋafàʼ pɔ́ɔn, à cʉa púʼu, mèŋ n gʉa ńgyá fùɔ, mbɔɔ páʼ lepʉ̌ lʉʼ. À lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ gie n ge kwé, n kwé!
en: “Go and assemble all the Jews who can be found in Susa and fast for me. Don’t eat or drink for three days,   night or day. I and my female servants will also fast  # 4:16 Est 9:31 in the same way. After that, I will go to the king even if it is against the law.  # 4:16 Est 5:1–2 If I perish, I perish.”  # 4:16 Gn 43:14

ngiemboon: Mandoshÿe la gʉa ńgÿo kwàʼ páʼ Ésétà la gɔɔn né yé.
en: So Mordecai went and did everything Esther had commanded him.
